commentary.line: The trophy has been presented to Misbah. The rest of the team join their skipper with beaming smiles. It has beeen a tough tour for Pakistan but they will go home with a smile. That ends yet another series. But there's plenty more to come. India are the next team to tour Bangladesh. It's a short tour, just one Test and 3 ODIs. The one-off Test starts at Fatullah on June 10th. Do join us for all the action. For now, cheers and bye..

Azhar Ali: 'It's a combined effort from the team. Everyone played their part in this Test series. Thanks to the training staff, they backed us very well. Getting centuries is very satisfying, but getting a double ton is special. We always try to match the class of Younis Khan. He is an inspiration for us. We have played really well in the past few series. We are proving ourselves to be a very good Test team. All the credit should go to the team management.'
Azhar Ali is the MoM as well as the MoS

Misbah: 'It was a much needed win for us. The team showed good character. The first session of this Test was very important. Azhar and Younis set up a superb base for us and the bowlers took advantage of it. Our bowlers enjoyed bowling on this surface. There wasn't much help for them, but they did extremely well, particularly Yasir. I wish my team a good series against Zimbabwe. I hope they improve their performance in the ODIs and T20Is. It's good that cricket is coming back to our country. Congrats to Bangladesh for the way they played in this series. The draw in the first Test was a sort of victory for them. Everyone were disappointed with the way the first Test panned out, we needed this win.'

Rahim: 'Obviously disappointed. We did a great job in the first Test, couldn't capitalize in the second. The two reprieves off no-balls, one bowler short, that hurt us. They are the number three ranked side and the results proved it. We have played some consistent cricket, this was the only match we lost throughout the series. The India series is coming up, we need to do well against them. Tamim, Shakib and Mominul had a great series with the bat. The bowlers need to be more aggressive and take wickets in the middle. That will keep us in the match. We have to take 20 wickets, we need to plan better during the series against India.'

Bangladesh had batted for the best part of two days to draw the first Test in Khulna. A similar effort here wasn't easy, but there was a shocking lack of temperament shown by the hosts' top-order. Batsmen after batsmen fell to poor shots. The bowling was disciplined enough but they were never made to earn the wickets. Only Mominul showed some fight, but eventually, he also threw his wicket away. This has been a tough tour for Pakistan. They were blanked in the ODIs, beaten in the one-off T20I, but they will go home with a trophy to show for their efforts.

A comprehensive victory for Pakistan and they win the series by a 1-0 margin. They dominated the Test right from the start. Bangladesh didn't help their cause one bit after having chosen to bowl first. Azhar Ali and Younis Khan were reprieved in the form of no-balls and they cashed in. Azhar made his maiden double ton while Younis compiled yet another hundred. Pakistan eventually declared at 557/8. Bangladesh were shocking with the bat in the first innings. None of their batsmen barring Shakib Al Hasan showed a gumption to fight. The star allrounder was eventaully stranded on 89 as the hosts were bowled out for 203, conceding a deficit of 354 runs. Misbah opted to bat again and helped himself to a 72-ball 82. Pakistan eventually declared at 195/6, setting an improbable target of 550 runs for the hosts.

Pakistan players take a couple of stumps as souveniers. Waqar Younis and the rest of the team management celebrate in the dressing room. The Bangladesh players come out into the middle as the two teams shake hands. Pakistan will stay at third in the ICC Test points table. Bangladesh stay ninth.

56.5   Junaid Khan to Hom, out Bowled!! That's it! Hom has been castled and Bangladesh have been bowled out for 221. Pakistan win the series by 328 runs. That's as comprehensive as it gets. Junaid keeps it full and on the stumps, can't get a better yorker than that. Hom made room, swishes and misses. The ball crashes into the base of middle stump. Hom b Junaid Khan 39(55) [4s-6]
Junaid Khan to Hom, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

41.2   Yasir Shah to Mominul, out Caught by Shafiq!! Bangladesh are collapsing in a heap after lunch. This was tossed up invitingly outside off, Mominul came down the track and drilled it to the right of cover, he didn't bother to keep it down. Shafiq dives across and holds onto the sharp low chance. The end is nigh for Bangladesh. They have now lost their seventh wicket. Mominul c Shafiq b Yasir Shah 68(102) [4s-9]

The appeal is spontaneous and umpire Llong lifts the dreaded finger. Soumya Sarkar doesn't hang around, off he goes. Bangladesh slip into further trouble. Soumya Sarkar c Sarfraz Ahmed b Riaz 1(9)
Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Welcome back.. Wahab set to resume after lunch..

That's lunch on day 4. Pakistan have taken full control of this Test match. Bangladesh scored 71 runs in the session but lost four wickets in the process. The bowling was disciplined from the visitors. They tested the patience of the Bangladeshi batsmen and reaped the rewards. Tamim and Mahmuduallh slashed at one that could have been easily left alone, Shakib's attempted counter punch flopped and Rahim chopped a harmless delivery back onto his stumps. At the other end, Mominul was a picture of concentration and techinique as he raised yet another fifty. A defeat looks all but certain but how long can Bangladesh resist? Join us in a while for the resumption..

Pitch Report: 'The cracks are widening, there will be indifferent bounce. The ball will be scruffed up and it will help the bowlers get reverse swing. Tough day for the Bangladeshi batsmen', reckons Aamir Sohail

Shakib: I thought they bowled really well, especially the pacers. We needed to apply better, we lost too many wickets. But today is a new day, we will look to fight. The first hour will be very crucial. I expected them to make us follow-on. In a way, it was good for us that they changed their plans, but there's a still a long way to go. The second innings performance at Khulna has given us plenty of confidence.Everyone has to fight, but the onus is on the top-order batsmen to get the runs.

09:45 Local Time, 03:45 GMT, 09:15 IST: It's Day 4 of the second and final Test between Bangladesh and Pakistan. After being Banglawashed in the ODIs, after having lost the one-off T20I, Pakistan are finally inching closer towards securing their first win of the tour. Eight wickets stand between them and a series victory. Unlike Khulna, where Bangladesh managed to hold on for two days, the Mirpur track has been condusive to the bowlers. Wahab Riaz's pace was too much to handle for the Bangladeshi batsmen in the first innings and Yasir Shah has been thretening in their second innings. Bangladesh need a further 487 runs to secure an unlikely victory. Can Pakistan finish off proceedings today?

Pakistan are right on top and with a lot of assistance from the pitch, they would fancy their chances tomorrow. Can Bangladesh put up a spirited show and push the game into the final day? Only time will tell. Join us back tomorrow for all the action from Day 4. Until then, take care, goodbye!

In reply, Tamim and Kayes batted positively and kept Junaid and Imran at bay. Misbah then introduced Yasir Shah into the attack and he broke the gritty opening stand by castling Kayes with a big leg-spinner. Riaz too bowled with a lot of gas and troubled both Tamim and Mominul on a few occasions. However, the duo managed to survive and remained unbeaten.

Stumps, Day 3: 354 runs scored for the loss of 11 wickets today. Bangladesh resumed their first innings in the morning but could not handle a fiery spell from Riaz and lost a couple of quick wickets. Shakib then played an aggressive innings to push them past 200. In reply, Pakistan did not mind losing wickets as they looked for runs. Skipper Misbah led from the front with a fine fifty. Eventually, after Misbah was dismissed for 82, Pakistan declared their second innings to set Bangladesh a target of 550.

Sarfraz is running off the field and Pakistan have declared. So their bowlers will have just over an hour to bowl at Bangladesh today. Pakistan were always on the lookout for runs and did not mind losing wickets in the process. Skipper Misbah-ul-Haq played well and hit some lusty blows and the target for Bangladesh now is 550.

Tea, Day 3: Just 23 overs bowled in the session, poor over rate from Bangladesh. Pakistan looked to play some shots and in the process lost Sami Aslam and Azhar Ali. Younis Khan and Misbah-ul-Haq then treated the bowling on merit and increased Pakistan's lead. Is Misbah think about the declaration? Join us back after the break to find out.

Welcome back. The players are making their way out to the middle.

Lunch, Day 3: Bangladesh got the early wicket of Hafeez, but Pakistan are well and truly on top. Earlier in the day, barring Shakib, none of the Bangladeshi batsmen applied themselves. Yasir Shah and Riaz picked up three wickets each, while Junaid got two. Shakib and Shahid added 63 runs for the 9th wicket and frustrated Pakistan. The former counter-attacked in grand style and also registered a breezy fifty. Despite having a big lead, Pakistan did not enforce the follow-on as they wanted to add more runs before have another go at the hosts.

Pakistan continued the good work and bowled well early in the morning. Wahab Riaz bowled with a lot of gas and removed Soumya Sarkar early. He dismissed Shuvagata Hom next ball, but could not get a hat-trick as he bowled one down the leg-side. Taijul Islam played an ugly shot to be bowled by Mohammad Hafeez, but Shakib Al Hasan farmed the strike, scored at will and registered a fine fifty. Pakistan looked frustrated as Mohammad Shahid gave good company to Shakib. In fact, 62 runs of the 63-run stand for the 9th wicket were scored by Shakib. Eventually, Yasir Shah dismissed the former to end the innings.

Shahadat Hossain, who injured his knee on Day 1, will not come out to bat and that is the end of Bangladesh's first innings. Will Pakistan enforce the follow-on? No, they haven't. Pakistan will bat again.

The players are making their way out to the middle. Yasis Shah will complete the over with, slip, silly-point and short leg in place.
Pitch Report: "The cracks are opening up and slightly moving. The pitch is very dry. If Bangladesh are to save this match, they will have to play extremely well," reckons Aamer Sohail.
"It is very satisfying to score a hundred. After scoring a lot of runs, the bowlers did a great job yesterday. To get five wickets was a bonus," says Azhar Ali.

Welcome to Day 3 of the second Test. It's a crucial morning session for the hosts. They cannot afford to throw away wickets if they are to stay alive in this Test match. They were completely blown in the final session yesterday as Pakistan bowled exceptionally well after a good show with the bat. The pitch has something in it for the bowlers and it is going to be hard work for the hosts.

Yasir Shah is already looking dangerous on this pitch and the fast bowlers too are getting some help from the surface. Bangladesh need 251 more to avoid follow-on and life is certainly not going to be easy tomorrow. That's it for the day. Join us back tomorrow for all the action from Day 3. Take care. Goodbye!

Junaid Khan then removed Tamim Iqbal in the first over, but Imrul Kayes played a counter-attacking knock to transfer the pressure back on the Pakistani bowlers. After a while, Junaid accounted for Mominul Haque, before Yasir Shah castled Kayes in his very first over. Wahab Riaz bowled with a lot of pace and bowled a nasty ball to get rid of Mahmudullah and Yasir Shah knocked over Mushfiqur Rahim in the last over of the day to end the day on a high.

Pakistan began the day at 323/3 and lost Misbah very early. However, Asad Shafiq joined Azhar Ali at the crease and the duo batted sensibly to share a 227-run stand. In the process, Ali registered his maiden Test double-hundred, while Shafiq recorded his 6th Test hundred. Having lost wickets in quest of some quick runs, Misbah declared Pakistan's innings at Tea.

Stumps, Day 2: What a day for Pakistan. They are in total control of this Test match now. After posting a mammoth first innings total, the bowlers have responded extremely well to reduce Bangladesh to 107/5 in the final session. They have certainly justified Misbah-ul-Haq's call to declare the innings at Tea.

0.4   Junaid Khan to Tamim, out Lbw!! What a start for Pakistan. Tamim, who scored a brilliant double-hundred in the last game is out in the very first over. Big blow for Bangladesh. Good length delivery on the stumps, as always, Tamim plants his front foot across the line, pointing towards cover to be precise. Hence he has to play around it and tries to work it on the on-side, misses and is hit in line with middle. Umpire Paul Reiffel took a long time to make the decision and Hawk-Eye showed that the ball would have clipped the top of middle and leg. Bangladesh have lost a review as well. Tamim lbw b Junaid Khan 4(4) [4s-1]
Junaid Khan to Tamim, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Tamim Iqbal has been given OUT LBW, he has a chat with his partner and decides to review. Is height an issue there? Hit above the knee-roll. Remember, it has to completely miss the sticks for the on-field call to be overturned. Oh dear! That's umpire's call says Hawk-Eye and Tamim is OUT.

Tamim and Kayes are at the crease. Tamim is on strike. Junaid Khan will open the attack
Three slips, a gully and a short leg in place
Interestingly, the sun is out now.
Welcome back.. Looks like Pakistan have declared. A good decision I guess. The conditions are perfect for swing bowling and their bowlers would enjoy bowling in the last session.

Tea, Day 2: Pakistan grow from strength to strength. They've had another excellent session in which they've scored 129 runs. Azhar Ali continued his good work and recorded his maiden Test double-hundred, while Asad Shafiq scored a well compiled hundred. Pakistan lost a few quick wickets towards the end of the session as they were looking to accelerate. It looks like they want to add a few quick runs and further increase their total. There is a bit of cloud cover and Bangladesh's reply is going to be very interesting. Join us back in a short while for the final session.

151.6   T Islam to Yasir Shah, out Lbw!! Slider from Taijul, the length was short and Yasir Shah went on the back foot to pull, but the ball kept low and hit him on the back leg. The impact was in line with middle and leg stump and Hawk-Eye agreed with the umpire that it would have clipped the leg stump. Yasir Shah lbw b T Islam 0(1)
T Islam to Yasir Shah, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Yasir Shah has been given out LBW, but he's reviewed it. Did he get an inside edge? No bat involved. Looks pretty adjacent. The on-field call is OUT, so it has to miss the stumps. Even if it is clipping the leg stump, Yasir Shah will have to walk back. We are waiting for Hawk-Eye. Here it comes! Umpire's call says technology and Yasir Shah is OUT

Welcome back for the post-lunch session...

Lunch, Day 2: 105 runs for the loss of one wicket in 33 overs, a great session for Pakistan. Although they lost Misbah-ul-Haq very early, Asad Shafiq and Azhar Ali played sensibly to share a 100 partnership. In the process, Azhar Ali surpassed his previous best in Test cricket, while Asad Shafiq recorded his 12th Test fifty. Mushfiqur Rahim rotated his bowlers but they couldn't separate the pair. Declaration imminent in the next session. Stay tuned...

Meanwhile, Younis Khan says he dedicates his hundred to earthquake victims of Nepal and India and also flood sufferers in Pakistan.

Hello and welcome to Day 2 of the second Test. Things did not go according to plan yesterday for Bangladesh and they need to play good cricket today to stop Pakistan from posting a mammoth total. Azhar Ali and Misbah-ul-Haq would want to extend Pakistan's advantage in the morning session, before upping the ante. It is a big blow for Bangladesh that pacer Shahadat Hossain, who injured his knee in the very first over the match, has been ruled out of action for six months. Although Rahim has a lot of option to choose from, he has only three frontline bowlers left. Life is not going to be all that easy for the hosts, but they will have to find a way to do well today.

So at the moment, Pakistan are in firm control of proceedings. Bangladesh need to take some early wickets tomorrow to prevent the visitors from posting a mammoth total on the board. Join us back tomorrow for all the action from Day 2. Looking forward to your company then. Take care, goodbye!

Lunch would have tasted much better for the hosts, but Shahid overstepped the line when Soumya Sarkar caught Azhar Ali's outside edge at third slip. Ali used the opportunity and went on to share a mammoth 250-run stand with Younis Khan, who upped the ante in the second session. Both batsmen completed hundreds and forced Bangladesh to use as many as nine bowlers. Soon after the second new ball was taken, Younis Khan, who was also caught off a no-ball before reaching his hundred, cut a Shahid delivery straight to the fielder.

Stumps, Day 1: Not the kind of day for Bangladesh, who opted to bowl first expecting their bowlers to get some early wickets with a bit of grass on the surface. In fact, they got off to a disastrous start as Shahadat Hossain walked off the field with a knee injury. Although Mohammad Shahid removed Mohammad Hafeez very early, Sami Aslam and Azhar Ali steadied the visitors with a 49-run stand before the former gifted his wicket minutes before the lunch break.

Tea, Day 1: 126 runs in 31 overs, a session totally dominated by Pakistan. Azhar Ali and Younis Khan took their time to get settled and then played their shots. Bangladesh could not stem the run flow and the duo scored at a healthy rate. The hosts tried everything but both batsmen used their experience and dominated the bowlers.

Welcome back for the second session...

Sami Aslam battled hard and just when he was looking to build a partnership with Ali, he gifted his wicket to Taijul Islam. The good news for Bangladesh is that Shahadat is back on the field and will be able to bowl in the second session.

Lunch, Day 1: Bangladesh would be reasonably happy with their show, but they would have wanted more wickets, especially after opting to bowl first. They got off to a disastrous start though as opening bowler Shahdat Hossain walked off the field after injuring his knee in the very first over. Mohammad Shahid then gave the hosts the first breakthrough by accounting for Mohammad Hafeez. Shahid had Azhar Ali caught at third slip, but unfortunately he overstepped the line and gave Ali a life.

Bangladesh have won the toss and have opted to field

The hosts have won the ODI and the T20 series. Can they go one step further and secure a Test series win. Only time will tell. Rahim hurt his finger while trying to catch Azhar Ali's outside edge in the first innings of the first Test. Although he is certain to play this game, he could play purely as a batsman, thereby giving Litton Das a Test debut. We'll get the confirmation in a short while as the toss isn't too far away. Stay tuned...

We saw Bangladesh playing some exceptional cricket to come from behind and secure a draw in the first Test match in Khulna. Mohammad Hafeez and Tamim Iqbal batted very well to notch up double-hundreds, while Taijul Islam bagged six-wicket haul. What is in store for us here in Dhaka in the final Test match of the series? Hello and a warm welcome to the second Test match between hosts Bangladesh and Pakistan. The pitch was purely batsman-friendly in the first Test and after the completion of the game, skipper Mushfiqur Rahim said that he hopes to get a sportive wicket for the second Test.

Preview

Bangladesh hope to build on their new-found confidence by securing their first-ever Test victory over Pakistan when the second and final match starts in Dhaka on Wednesday.The Tigers are buoyed by a remarkable fightback in the drawn first Test in Khulna where they avoided defeat for the first time in nine matches against Pakistan despite trailing by 296 runs in the first innings.

The gallant display followed their dominant form against the struggling Pakistanis in the limited-overs contests where the hosts swept the one-day series 3-0 and easily won the lone Twenty20 international.

In Khulna, Bangladesh showed their batting prowess as Tamim Iqbal hit his nation's highest score of 206 and shared a 312-run opening stand with Imrul Kayes (150) in the second innings.Bangladesh's series wins so far since gaining Test status in 2000 have come against fellow wooden-spooners Zimbabwe and against an under-strength West Indies.

But former Test captain Habibul Bashar felt the time had arrived for Bangladesh to take a major step forward and win the series against Pakistan, who are placed third in the official rankings.

"We can surely go for the kill," Bashar said ahead of the Test at the Sher-e-Bangla stadium. "We have a positive mindset which can help us gain an edge over the opponents.

"Our comeback in Khulna raised the team's confidence to a new level. Not many teams can do what we did against a side like Pakistan who have such a versatile bowling attack.After such a performance, the boys will naturally look for a win in Dhaka," he said.

Bangladesh are worried about the fitness of captain and wicket-keeper Mushfiqur Rahim, having already lost strike seam bowler Rubel Hossain for the Test due to a side strain.Rahim hurt a finger on the right hand while attempting a catch in Khulna and left the field. He batted in the second innings but was dismissed without scoring.

Bashar, a selector, said that Rahim could be replaced behind the stumps by the uncapped Litton Das, who was a wicketkeeper at under-19 level.

"Rahim can play as a batsman alone, but if he is unable to keep, we may include Litton," he said.

Pakistan have brought in all-rounder Bilawal Bhatti to replace seamer Rahat Ali, who had been ruled out of the tour ahead of the first Test due to a hamstring injury.

It was uncertain if star off-spinner Saeed Ajmal will be recalled after being ignored for the third one-dayer and the Khulna Test.Ajmal, who returned to international cricket with a remodelled action in the preceding limited-overs series, failed to impress with just one wicket in three games on the tour.

Ajmal told the Cricinfo that he needed time to regain confidence and return to his best.

"I knew it will be tough moving forward," said Ajmal. "I'd said prior to coming here that I need time and I am disappointed that I am not able to fulfil the expectations of the nation.But I spoke to the captain and the coach and they have a plan for me. I need time to regain my confidence. It does not come overnight."
Teams:

Pakistan (From): Mohammad Hafeez, Sami Aslam, Azhar Ali, Younis Khan, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Asad Shafiq, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Wahab Riaz, Yasir Shah, Zulfiqar Babar, Junaid Khan, Haris Sohail, Saeed Ajmal, Imran Khan, Babar Azam, Bilawal Bhatti

Bangladesh (From): Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Mahmudullah, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim(c/w), Soumya Sarkar, Taijul Islam, Shuvagata Hom, Mohammad Shahid, Shahadat Hossain, Litton Das, Jubair Hossain, Abul Hasan
